part.narration: A timer clicks. Nozomi is more than a guest at Yuki's. Both in night clothes, one relaxes in the futon and the other paces about. Yuki cradles the backlit digital timer.Yuki paces for nine seconds independent of player control. At each tenth second, she pushes a button on the timer and the player regains control.
part.line: Cinematics are the narrative of film.
Words are the narrative of literature.
part.narration: Ten Seconds. Yuki presses a button on the timer.The Player regains control.
part.line: Mechanics are the narrative of games.
The plot is the rules and the rules are the plot.
part.narration: Yuki clenches her fist.Walks faster independent of Player control.
part.line: Video games shouldn't even have cutscenes!
And if they do, they shouldn't be longer than a sixth-minute!
You're getting anxious again. Sit down.

choice.narration: Yuki is sitting too far from Nozomi.

part.narration: Timer start. Nozomi puts her arm around Yuki's shoulder. Fringe a-flow, Yuki sighs and leans in, trusting eyes closed. Nozomi embraces her. Nothing is audible. Ten seconds.
